Key Match Events: Axar Patel and Suryakumar Yadav shared a crucial 91-run stand to keep India alive in the chase.
Dasun Shanaka once again turned out to be the biggest nemesis of Indian team and scored unbeaten 56 runs, while opener Kusal Mendis also scored 52.
Pre-Game Insights: Hardik Pandya took some tough decisions in critical situations to test the team and it turned out well for the hosts.
The spotlight will be on Shubman Gill and Yuzvendra Chahal who failed to create any impact in the first T20I.
Arshdeep Singh returned to the side after recovering from the illness.
Rahul Tripathi is expected to make his international debut as Sanju Samson has been ruled out of the series after sustaining a knee injury.
Post-Match Reflections: Another excellent game of cricket but this time it was Sri Lanka who get over the line and levelled the three-match series 1-1.
The Indian bowlers had a rough night at the office, especially Arshdeep Singh who bowled five no-balls which cost India big time in the chase.
Umran Malik was the pick of the bowlers for claiming three wickets but he was also expensive by leaking 48 runs in his four overs.
Young Shivam Mavi who had a dream debut on Tuesday had a forgettable night where he leaked 53 runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shivam Mavi made his international debut as Sanju Samson has been ruled out of the series after sustaining a knee injury.
Dasun Shanaka once again turned out to be the biggest nemesis of Indian team and scored unbeaten 56 runs, while opener Kusal Mendis also scored 52.
Axar Patel and Suryakumar Yadav shared a crucial 91-run stand to keep India alive in the chase.
Others: India lost the top-order early with just 21 runs on the scoreboard.
Ishan Kishan, Shubman Gill and Rahul Tripathi played some loose shots which hurt India.
Hardik Pandya also dismissed cheaply for 12.
Deepak Hooda failed to replicate his form from the opening match and departed for 9.
